content: I noticed that the latest packages of the AU Base (e.g. 2.2.0) are not in the package registry. There are not added to the feed: https://github.com/FHIR/ig-registry/blob/master/package-feeds.json -> http://hl7.org.au/fhir/package-feed.xml. Would it be possible to update the feed?

Also, I noticed that the package.json of 2.2.0 states "version": "2.1.0"(downloaded from here http://hl7.org.au/fhir/history.html).
Another thing is that in package.json the"type": "fhir.ig" is not valid considering (https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/NPM+Package+Specification).
@Brett Esler something for you?
@Grahame Grieve is there a fixed list for "type" value in package feed? I was not too clear why fhir.ig was is an issue?
we changed the allowed values for type after a discussion a few weeks ago. see here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/NPM+Package+Specification#NPMPackageSpecification-Packagemanifest
for some reason, @Ardon Toonstra might know, there was apparently an expectation that this would become retrospectively applicable to already published content, but that's not possible
but for anything new, use IG not fhir.ig, and the tools will do this in the future

@Brett Esler An enhancement for the Simplifier.net's package importer behind the Registry to support these old values is in the works.
The "version": "2.1.0", in the package.json of hl7.fhir.au.pd#2.2.0 will however still prevent the import into the Registry, since it can't be sure what the version is you intended for this package.
As far as the Registry is concerned you can still change the package's contents under the same 2.2.0 version number, since it hasn't been imported yet. (No need to release the updated file as 2.2.1 at this point)
